instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B stuck on apple logo, very slow
threads.message:
i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, stuck on apple logo and can't boot on ADS OS, but it works on EFI.
all sensors is ok
if it goes into the system, it is very slow

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B stuck on apple logo, very slow
threads.message:
Have you tried a new HDD? This sounds like you are describing a dying spindle HDD.....

Try booting a known good SSD and see what result it yields.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B stuck on apple logo, very slow
threads.message: yes i tried SSD, and boot from external USB the same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B stuck on apple logo, very slow
threads.message: Try different PC3-12800S RAM, also have you try disconnect every internal connector but apart from LVDS, trackpad and keyboard to see if will boot on external USD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B stuck on apple logo, very slow
threads.message:
"can't boot on ADS OS, but it works on EFI"
Looks like GPU issue...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B stuck on apple logo, very slow
threads.message: Yes thanks, it was the GPU
